alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:27AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Volusia County through NOON EDT... At 1127 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Daytona International Speedway, or near Daytona Beach, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach, New Smyrna Beach, and South Daytona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
